1.text: The kingâ€™s heart is in the hand of Jehovah as the watercourses: He turneth it whithersoever he will.

2.text: Every way of a man is right in his own eyes; But Jehovah weighteth the hearts.

3.text: To do righteousness and justice Is more acceptable to Jehovah than sacrifice.

4.text: A high look, and a proud heart, Even the lamp of the wicked, is sin.

5.text: The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness; But every one that is hasty hasteth only to want.

6.text: The getting of treasures by a lying tongue Is a vapor driven to and fro by them that seek death.

7.text: The violence of the wicked shall sweep them away, Because they refuse to do justice.

8.text: The way of him that is laden with guilt is exceeding crooked; But as for the pure, his work is right.

9.text: It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, Than with a contentious woman in a wide house.

10.text: The soul of the wicked desireth evil: His neighbor findeth no favor in his eyes.

11.text: When the scoffer is punished, the simple is made wise; And when the wise is instructed, he receiveth knowledge.

12.text: The righteous man considereth the house of the wicked, How the wicked are overthrown to their ruin.

13.text: Whoso stoppeth his ears at the cry of the poor, He also shall cry, but shall not be heard.

14.text: A gift in secret pacifieth anger; And a present in the bosom, strong wrath.

15.text: It is joy to the righteous to do justice; But it is a destruction to the workers of iniquity.

16.text: The man that wandereth out of the way of understanding Shall rest in the assembly of the dead.

17.text: He that loveth pleasure shall be a poor man: He that loveth wine and oil shall not be rich.

18.text: The wicked is a ransom for the righteous; And the treacherous cometh in the stead of the upright.

19.text: It is better to dwell in a desert land, Than with a contentious and fretful woman.

20.text: There is precious treasure and oil in the dwelling of the wise; But a foolish man swalloweth it up.

21.text: He that followeth after righteousness and kindness Findeth life, righteousness, and honor.

22.text: A wise man scaleth the city of the mighty, And bringeth down the strength of the confidence thereof.

23.text: Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue Keepeth his soul from troubles.

24.text: The proud and haughty man, scoffer is his name; He worketh in the arrogance of pride.

25.text: The desire of the sluggard killeth him; For his hands refuse to labor.

26.text: There is that coveteth greedily all the day long; But the righteous giveth and withholdeth not.

27.text: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination: How much more, when he bringeth it with a wicked mind!

28.text: A false witness shall perish; But the man that heareth shall speak so as to endure.

29.text: A wicked man hardeneth his face; But as for the upright, he establisheth his ways.

30.text: There is no wisdom nor understanding Nor counsel against Jehovah.

31.text: The horse is prepared against the day of battle; But victory is of Jehovah.
